oai_dc:dc.dc:title: REDUCTION PROCESS OF CROSS-SECTIONAL AREA AT RIVER MOUTH
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Shimizu, Takuzo
Kondo, Kosuke
Kajima, Ryoichi
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: river mouth
reduction process
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Reduction processes of the cross-sectional area at a river mouth were investigated on the basis of numerical simulations and field measurements, in order to predict the possibility of closing of the mouth of the Samegawa River, Fukushima, Japan. As a result, it was found that the decrease in tidal prism, induced by a reduction of the cross-sectional area, had an important effect on the closing of the river mouth. By considering this effect and estimating the sediment transport rate properly, a practical prediction model was successfully established for simulating the reduction processes of the crosssectional area at the river mouth.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 20 (1986): Proceedings of 20th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Taipei, Taiwan, 1986.; 113
